intro: Phrygilanthus nudus, commonly known as the naked phrygilanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or a small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces pods that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
